reviews.review_msg: Prof. Heredia is an amazing professor who genuinely cares about her students. She is always willing to answer questions in lectures, office hours, and emails. She values learning over just grading and I admire her for her passion. Her class was easy to understand & assignments help you learn. She marks very fairly. A very kind & passionate person.
Dr. Buse is highly knowledgeable. He is really approachable and deeply cares for his students. Would take him again.

Bruce is a legend and is highly respected in the field of environmental health. He is incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about the field, and his lectures show this. His lectures are great, and if you come looking to learn you'll have the opportunity to learn from one of the best!

Easily one of the best profs at SFU. Bruce cares SO much about his students, and fought for years to make 483 a week long course. Seems tough at first, but brings in SO much amazing speakers and shares so many personal experiences in a way that makes you understand WHY he does what he does. Not a hard marker and gives AMAZING feedback!

Bruce is very passionate about his work, it is very inspiring. I found the lecture and the guest lecturers all engaging and he really encourages you to participate. I would definitely take a class with him again. This class was only 6 days in the summer with no exams!

Am was one of the most inspiring professors I have had the pleasure to take a class with during my undergrad at SFU. Although the midterm exam can be difficult, the class is fairly graded. She connected with all the students in the class, and promoted group discussion and connecting with our peers. Best PROF of my undergrad, by far

One of my best profs and fav. courses in my undergrad career. AM is passionate, knowledgeable,  and likes to get to know her students. Lectures were fun, engaging but more importantly, I found the material to be very valuable for any HSCI student. Doesn't believe in hard marking, believes more in ensuring students learn. Be prepared to present

Her first time teaching the class, so she was a little disorganized. Getting a hold of her in person & email can be challenging. Way too many presentations in class, and lectures. However, she's very knowledgae and approchable!
